instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2838: What is 820-2838? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A System clock problem
threads.message: When i turn off my <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A MacBook Air and then turn it on after hours the system clock is reseted to 2001.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A System clock problem
threads.message:
Even with the charger plugged in? 
Check <RESISTOR>R1920</RESISTOR>/21 and possible corrosion under MCP on the side of RTC Xtal.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2838</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A System clock problem
threads.message: I don't remember if it does it with charger but i will check if it does it with charger and also that. Thanks duke for answering but if you could help me with the retina screen. What would be the best way to rub off the coating?
